The surface morphology of the nanowire can be controlled by changing the pulling direction, as shown in Fig. 3 and Supplementary Movie 2. The initial pulling direction is about 26° away from a <110> direction of the nanowire, and the obtained nanowire developed a saw-tooth-shaped surface, as shown in Fig. 3a–c and Supplementary Movie 2. However, when the pulling direction is ~4° away from the same <110> direction, the nanowire can almost maintain a straight and smooth morphology, except for a few small surface steps, as shown in Fig. 3d, e and Supplementary Movie 3. Thus, it can be concluded that pulling along a low-index direction of the nanowire tends to produce a straight prismatic nanowire. Figure 4f is the dark-field image of the nanowire taken with
